beats.text: Hi, I'm Ian Frelinger. Emergencies move fast—tools shouldn't slow us down. Here's how we bring clear decisions to the front line.
Incident Commanders, planners, and dispatchers share the same view. Command sets intent; teams act quickly with less guesswork.

Feeds are fused on an H3 grid and scored by an ML model. Routing uses A Star. Foundry Functions expose it via REST: hazards, routes, risk, evacuations, units, public safety. Dashboards, mobile, and the AI assistant all read the same source of truth.
Hazards update live. A single click shows intensity and population at risk—fuel for triage: monitor, shelter, or evacuate.
Each card is a zone. Progress bars track evacuees, while building lists flag special needs and refusals—so teams focus where it matters.
A Star balances safety and time. Profiles match doctrine—civilians avoid hazards, EMS takes calculated risk, fire goes direct, police secures.
Ask in plain language. The assistant synthesizes hazards, units and traffic to recommend the next move—while you stay in command.
Processing converts detections to H3 cells, predicts spread, and scores risk. Routing builds a hazard-aware graph. Foundry Functions expose the fused data through a small, clean API.
Faster decisions, fewer hand-offs, and higher compliance—without drowning users in noise.
Thanks for watching. I'd love to discuss piloting this with your team.
